intro: Scandix australis subsp. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered sandparsley, is a perennial herb native to southern Australia. It features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or semi-arid regions. It is adapted to withstand drought and salt spray, making it resilient in harsh environments. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to local biodiversity.
